Summary For a more thorough resume please visit http://www.burninggnome.net/Resume.of.Daniel.Gilbert.IT.Consultant.pdf 
 
To Link to me send email to: 
daniel.gilbert@burninggnome.net 
 
 
I have over 15 years in technical consulting and more than 20 years in the IT industry. During that time, I have developed an expertise in current and emerging software applications and hardware. I have accumulated an outstanding history of strategic planning, project development, and client service. My current focus is on Active Directory planning, migrations, and maintenance. I have also created tailored software packages, images, group policies, and documentation so the clients can continue to manage their new environments after the project is finished.  
 
I have managed every aspect of IT projects. This includes initial bid proposals, planning stages, assessments, testing, implementation, and optimization of the projects. I enjoy using my expertise and experience to advise companies and clients to empower them to be able to manage their current and future environments in a proactive manner. In this way companies are anticipating problems, not chasing them.  
 
My background is quite varied, but I have spent a great deal of time becoming a Windows NT 4.0 expert and transitioning to Windows 2000 and Windows 2003. I’ve researched, implemented, and educated staff and clients on every aspect of Windows 2000/2003 and Active Directory. I have built a solid reputation based on dependable expertise. This has enabled my clients to effectively and efficiently identify and resolve problems before they affect related areas, personnel, or clients. 
 
Specialties: IT Consultant 
Microsoft Certified Trainer & Systems Engineer 
VMware Certified Professional

Summary Kevin Kielty founded SearchBrite/IMA in September 2007. As President and Solutions Architect, Mr. Kielty's strategic vision for SearchBrite/IMA focuses on three fundamental aspects: generating the best creative advertising possible; fostering innovation and utilizing the latest technology; and expanding into vertical markets across the United States. 
 
Prior to launching SearchBrite/IMA Mr. Kielty spent nine years leading technology projects at Hewlett Packard (HP), Electronic Data Systems (EDS), and IBM. During this time he held several leadership positions including: Application Systems Engineer, Project Manager, Senior Infrastructure Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, Senior Systems Administrator, Interface Design Consultant and Microsoft Systems Engineer.
